Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Siana cup; interior: narrow reserved band near top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: black bands at top and bottom of lip, framing myrtle leaf frieze; handle zone reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Brijder attributes the sherd to the Red-black Painter's middle period.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 377, no. B523)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 682, no. 503)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1319) (phase 3)
